english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the bailo's request regarding the dispute between emins of the port who wanted Venetian merchants to bring their stuff to the port for customs. However, in line with the ahdname and previous imperial orders, merchants who come to purchase goods with their money and silver directly go to the house of bailo in Haleb. As such a request by the emins is against the ahdname, the bailo petitioned for their removal. The Ottoman officials are ordered to allow money and silver to be stored at the bailo's house but also to control the bailo's house in case there is anythig that is against the ahdname.

english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r upon the bailo's request regarding the dispute between an Ottoman subject, Mehmed, and the Venetian bailo in Egypt. Mehmed, who had been enslaved by warring corsairs and then freed, claimed that the previous Venetian bailo in Egypt, Cevan Kosto, guaranteed to cover his losses and went to the Porte to demand the mentioned losses from the new Venetian bailo in Egypt with documents. In the court attended by the Grandvizier Mehmed PaÙa, his case was dropped and a fetva was given indicating that the new Venetian bailo was not responsbile for his losses. However, Mehmed continued to oppress the bailo by showing some orders. The beylerbeyi of Egypt is ordered not to allow him to oppress the bailo. If Mehmed presents any orders from the Porte, the beylerbeyi is ordered to delay processing and contact Istanbul.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  63
english_summary: Order sent to the beys and kad€±s of €¡nebaht€± upon the bailo's request regarding the appointment of a consul to Mora. Accordingly, the consul may choose to live in Mora or Balyabadra or any other place that he prefers. He is not to be oppressed or interfered. If there are any Venetian subjects that are enslaved they are to be returned to the consul unless they convert toIslam. If there are any Venetian ships, goods, and subjects captured by corsairs, the local authorities and people are expected to save them and return them to the consul. Nobody should demand tribute or gifts from Venetian merchants. If a merchant dies, his belongings are to be given to the consul. The consul is responsible for the disputes between Venetian subjects. If someone somehow obtains an order from the Porte in contrast to what is explained above, send those orders to the Porte before taking any action.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  107 108
english_summary: Order sent to Mehmed vizier in M€±s€±r (Egypt) upon the request of the bailo regarding commercial disputes between Venetians that also involve some Ottoman subjects (See record no.s 145, 173). Merchants from Venice sent goods to two Venetian merchants, Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni who are residents in Egypt. Upon hearing their bad reputations, merchants who sent the goods changed their mind and wrote letters to the Venetian bailo in Egypt to take care of their goods and not to give them to Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni. However, Nikola Alfarati who was in debt to some Muslim, Christian and Jewish dealers, wanted to use these goods to cover his debt. Thus he claimed to be the legitimate receiver of the goods.The beylerbeyi is ordered not to allow him or other to oppress the bailo. In accordance with ahdname, a Venetian merchant is responsible for his own debts and bailos cannot be oppressed for such issues. The bailo in Egypt should take care of the goods sent from Venice.

Merchants from Venice sent goods to two Venetian merchants, Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni who are residents in Egypt. Upon hearing their bad reputations, merchants who sent the goods changed their mind and wrote letters to the Venetian bailo in Egypt to take care of their goods and not to give them to Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni. However, Nikola Alfarati who was in debt to some Muslim, Christian and Jewish dealers, wanted to use these goods to cover his debt. Thus he claimed to be the legitimate receiver of the goods.The pasha and kad€± are ordered not to allow him or other to oppress the bailo. In accordance with ahdname, a Venetian merchant is responsible for his own debts and bailos cannot be oppressed for such issues. The bailo in Egypt should take care of the goods sent from Venice.
agencies: M€±s€±r Beylerbeyi Vezir Mehmed PaÙa;M€±s€±r Kad€±s€±;Venedik balyosu

english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regarding killing of a Venetian merchant in Banaluka, Bosna. Although orders were sent to the kad€±s and other local governors of the areas regarding arrival and protection of two Venetian merchants doing business, Yakmo BireÙani was killed. Following this incident, local defterdar and kad€± came to his house and took his goods, money, temessÌ_ks and other documents. They sold these in the market. As this act is against the ahdname, those local officials and Ali are to be punished. The beylerbeyi is ordered to punish them and return belongings of the late Venetian merchant to the Venetian dragoman, Cenazin.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  124- 128
english_summary: Order sent to Mehmed PaÙaof M€±s€±r (Egypt) upon the request of the bailo regarding commercial disputes between Venetians that also involve some Ottoman subjects. Merchants from Venice sent goods to two Venetian merchants, Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni who are residents in Egypt. Upon hearing their bad reputations, merchants who sent the goods changed their mind and wrote letters to the Venetian bailo in Egypt to take care of their goods and not to give them to Nikola Alfarati and Anderya Gadanni. However, Nikola Alfarati who was in debt to some Muslim, Christian and Jewish dealers, wanted to use these goods to cover his debt. Thus he claimed to be the legitimate receiver of the goods.Although orders sent previously to protect these goods and deliver them to the Venetian bailo in Egypt, some of them were taken by other merchants or some of them were claimed to be taken for miri . The pasha is ordered to find those goods and return them to the Venetians.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  17
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of Manisa upon the request of the bailo regarding two Venetian merchants who were accused of killing a women by running over her with a horse . The case brought to the court and it was decided that the women in fact died of plague. Although, they were found not quilty, some people still oppress them which is against the ahdname. The kad€± is ordered to protect those merchants. If those people continue to oppress, the kad€± is ordered to report their names and descriptions to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  18
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€±s of €¡zmir and Manisa and sancakbeyis of Ayd€±n and Saruhan upon the request of the bailo regarding the Venetian merchants in these areas. The merchants are forced to buy some goods from local officials including sipahis and janissaries. The kad€±s and sancakbeyis are ordered to prevent those people from forcing the merchants to buy goods with higher prices and from oppressing them.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  19
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of Manisa and sancakbey of Saruhan upon the request of the bailo in Istanbul regarding Hac€± Arslan who received 16 sacks of cotton from Nikola to be delivered to the Venetian merchants in €¡zmir. However, he kept the cotton and never delivered. The kad€± and sancakbey are ordered to find him and investigate the issue. If it is true, they are ordered to get the cotton and give it to the Venetians. If he does not comply, the kad€± and sancakbey are ordered to report this to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  20
english_summary: Order sent to the dizdars (custodians) of fortresses by the sea regarding the capture of a Venetian ship. Dizdar are asked to return the ship, Venetian subjects and their goods as ordered by an imperial decree.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  21
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± and sancakbeyi of Karl€± upon the request of the bailo regarding the enslavement of six Venetian subjects who were fishing in the area and corsair activities of the sancakbeyi Muhammed. The sancakbeyi apparently enslaved those Venetian subject and carried out some corsair activities with a kalyata. The sancakbeyi is ordered to return the Venetian subject and stop such illegal activities as they are against the ahdname. The kad€± is ordered to watch over the sancakbey and report him to the Porte if he does not obey the orders.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  22
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey and kad€± of Karl€±ili and dizdars of Ayamavra fortress upon the request of the bailo regarding corsair activies of Muhammed Bey, sancakbey of Karl€±ili, and others. Apparently they built kalyota and other ships for such activities in the Venetian Bay. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  23
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey of Karl€±ili and kad€± of Ayamavra upon the request of the bailo regarding Muhammed bey, who was the sancakbey of Karl€±ili. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 330 Page  22
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi and kad€± of Haleb and kad€± of Ser mi n upon Venetian bailo's request regarding Mahmud, who purchased goods from Venetian merchants when he was a defterdar of Haleb but failed to pay the remaining balance. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  24

HÌ_seyin apparently got the approval of the sancakbey of Delvine for his plans. The sancakbeyi and kad€± is ordered to stop him and never let anyone build anything on the Venetian lands or oppress the Venetian subjects.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  25
english_summary: Order sent to the Kapudan Muhammed PaÙa of Cezair upon the bailo's request regarding the capture of a Venetian barÌ¤a carrying goods worth of 300 thousand gold, which was captured by corsairs. Now the kapudan is ordered to find those goods and punish the corsairs and their collaborators.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  26

The Ottoman magistracies addressed are ordered to let those horses pass through and not to interfere with this issue.

english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the bailo's request regarding the Venetian merchants' houses on the seashore in €¡zmir. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  28
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna, Mustafa PaÙa, upon the request of the bailo regarding protection of the coastal areas and people from corsairs. As agreed, the Venetians asigned a general for this duty. He managed to capture some of the Uskok corsairs and freed the people that the Uskoks enslaved. There were also reports that some people are constructing ships for corsair activities in Makarska and Gabelle. The pasha is ordered to protect the areas under his responsibility from the corsairs and investigate the ship-building issue in Makarska and other places.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  29
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± and dizdar of Nova regarding a Venetian ship whose captain bought salt and on his way he was attacked by corsairs. He noted that the corsairs took the ship towards Avlonya and DraÌ¤ but due to the weather conditions, they arrived in PeÙtrovnik which is under the Venetian rule. The people in this region took the salt and the ship. Hearing of this, the governor of Kotor ordered the ship to be brought to Kotor. As Venetians were on their way to Kotor, the corsairs attacked again and took the ship to Nova. The kad€± and dizdar are ordered to return the ship to the Venetians. They are to report anyone who interferes in this affair to the Porte.

english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna regarding the killing of two Ottoman subjects in €¡spalad which is governed by Venice. Some franks (Europeans) killed Hasan ans Veli and took their money and goods, which belong to the Porte. When it was asked to the bailo in €¡stanbul, he said that he was not aware of such an evil act. He assured to report this and send a letter to the governor in €¡spalad to have the killers found and goods returned to the Porte. If the bailo becomes a guarantor to a merchant, he should be punished with prison under no circumstances. The bailo, dragomans and other Venetians are to be protected at all times.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  45
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r upon the request of the bailo regarding an inn known as KÌ_Ì¤Ì_k Han and used by the Venetian merchants since ancient times. The rent for the inn has traditionally been paid by the customs but now the Venetian merchants have been harassed to pay the rent. As it is customary to pay the rent from the customs revenues, the beylerbeyi is ordered to protect the merchants and have the rent paid from the customs.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  46
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the bailo's request regarding €¡zoppo Borgoti's court case in which he claims share of some goods. In order to support his case, he brought some other Venetians to the court. However, their testimony was not accepted by saying that only Ottoman subject non-Muslims can be witnesses. The kad€± is ordered to ignore this and obey the ahdname granted to the Venetians in which it is granted that they can be witnesses in the court.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  47
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbeyi of €¡lbasan and dizdar of DiraÌ¤ upon the bailo's request regarding corsair activities of Ottoman subjects in the Venetian Bay. In spite of numerous orders sent previously to stop corsair activities in the Venetian Bay, such corsairs have continued to attack Venetians. Also, sancakbey of Dukagin is reported to have kalyata built to sail in the bay and do corsair actvities. The Ottoman administrators addressed are ordered to stop corsairs and destroy their ships.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  48
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r upon the request of the bailo regarding tax onwine imposed on the Venetians. Apparently in accordance with ahdname, the Venetians are free from taxes on wine when they purchase it for their own drinking.However, taxes have been demanded from the Venetians. The beylerbeyi is ordered not to request any tax or fee for wine when merchants purchase it for their own drinking purposes in accordance with the order given earlier.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  49
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi and defterdar of M€±s€±r upon the bailo's request regarding the allowance of the Venetian bailo in Egypt. The bailo in Egypt has received 50 sikke per year since the ancient times. However, he was not given this year's allowance and harassed. The beylerbeyi and defterdar are ordered to inquire this issue and, if the bailo has not been paid, to pay him in full every year in accordance with the tradition.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  50
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the request of the bailo regarding Mustafa ÌàavuÙ who did not allow Venetian merchants to buy non-restricted goods. The kad€± is ordered to stop such acts that are against the ahdname and report to the Porte the people who disobey it.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  51
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the letter of his naib, Mevlana Abdurrahman regarding attack of Mustafa ÌàavuÙ and Sinan bey on the Venetians including kaymakam €¡zoppo Borgoti and two merchants. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  53
english_summary: Mektub sent by Kapudan Mehmed PaÙa to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r regarding the Venetian bailo in M€±s€±r (Egypt). The beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r was praised for his good treatment of the Venetian bailo. Apparently, the Venetian bailo purchased a mukataa ( h€±yar-€± Ùanbar ) for eight years. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  54
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna regarding the attack of the bandits who are in colloboration with Lika sancakbeyi Halil and Mustafa on the Venetian lands near Zadra fortress. They have enslaved many Venetian subjects and took their herds. As such acts are against the conditions of peace and ahdname, the beylerbeyi is ordered to find Mustafa and send him to the Porte and return the Venetian subjects and their herds back. He is to find Halil Bey, imprison him and inform the Porte about the situation. He is also ordered to prevent such incursions.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  58
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbeyi of Kilis regarding the border disputes in Bosna and attack of the Ottoman subjects and bandits on the Venetian lands. In spite of the previous orders and ahdname, some people continued to attack Venetian subjects, enslaved them and took their herds in the borderland region. Orders regarding the same issue have been sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna. The sancakbeyi is ordered to find such evil doers and punish them in accordance with the adhname. He is also ordered to return Venetian subject and herds back to the Venetian beys.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  60
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo regarding extra fees demanded by emins at the port. It is said that the Venetian merchants traditionally pays what is written in the ahdname to the emins at the port. However, the emins demanded more than these fees. There was another order sent by the maliye (finances department) in this vein. The Ottoman magistracies addressed are ordered to warn the emins so that they won't demand anything more than what is required by the ahdname and also act according to the order sent earlier. If emins at the port show them orders saying that they could charge more, the Ottoman officials are ordered to postpone implementation of such orders.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  61
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€±s of Haleb and €¡skenderun upon the request of the bailo regarding goods brought in at the port of €¡slenderun and contained in barrels and chests. It has been the case that such barrels and chests are registered in €¡skenderun but opened in Haleb. And their customs fees have been paid in Haleb .It has been suggested that barrels and chests should be opened in €¡skenderun when they arrive. However, when such barrels and chests opened, their transport could be hazardous for goods inside. Thus, there is possibility that merchants may suffer losses. Therefore, it is ordered that they are to be registered in €¡skenderun but opened when they arrive in Haleb as it has been the case.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  62
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo in €¡stanbul regarding fees demanded at the customs. It is reported that emins in Haleb demand more than what is required from the Venetian merchants and thus they oppress the Venetians. The Ottoman magistracies are ordered to prevent such implementations from happening and only have them charge what is recorded in the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  63
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo regarding customs fees demanded from the Venetians. It is reported that the defterdar of Haleb treasury has been demanding fees that is more than what is written in the ahdname by claiming that he holds a decree for this. And he has been taking the goods of the Venetian merchants to his home instead of keeping them in the customs house. The beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar are ordered to stop this and only demand what is written in the ahdname. They are also ordered to report people who disobey this order to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  64
english_summary: Order sent to the mutasarr€±f of Hersek who was the previous beylerbeyi of Bosna and to the kad€± of Nova upon the bailo's request regarding corsair activities of some Ottoman subjects from Nova. Although decrees have been sent earlier ordering that such activities were to be stopped, some people from Nova still harm Venetians trading along the coast and Venetian subjects from Kotor. €¡brahim PaÙa and kad€± are ordered to stop these people and punish them accordingly.
agencies: Sab€±kan Bosna Beylerbeyi olub hala ber vech-i arpal€±k Hersek sanca€Ù€±na mutasarr€±f olan €¡brahim PaÙa;Nova Kad€±s€±;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 330 Page  26
english_summary: Orders sent to the kad€± of Tripoli upon the bailoi's request regarding Mehmed ibn Mansur who acted against the ahdname and oppressed the Venetian merchants by extracting 4 thousand guruÙ for himself and a thousand for the defterdar. An imperial order is requested by the bailo to return this money. Ottoman officials are ordered to inquire and return the money and stop such implementation that are against the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  65
english_summary: Mektub sent by Mehmed PaÙa to the kad€± and dizdar of Nova regarding corsair activities of Ottoman subject from Nova . In spite of the decrees sent from the Porte, such people still harm Venetian subjects. The kad€± and dizdar are asked to stop them and punish those people and burn their ships.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  66
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Agha of Janissaries to the SubaÙ€± of the Nova fortress regarding the corsair activities of some people from Nova as explained in the previous two documents. The subaÙ€± is asked to prevent such corsairs activities in his region in line with the previous orders sent by the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  67
english_summary: Order sent to the mutasarr€±f of Hersek who was the previous beylerbeyi of Bosna and kad€± of Nova upon the request of the bailo regarding corsair activities of some people from Nova. In spite of numerous orders sent previously, they continue to harass the Venetians in the Venetian bay. They are ordered to stop them immediately in line with the previous documents.
agencies: Sab€±kan Bosna beylerbeyisi olup hala ber vech-i arpal€±k Hersek sanca€Ù€±na mutasarr€±f olan €¡brahim PaÙa;Nova Kad€±s€±;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  68
english_summary: Mektub sent by €¡brahim PaÙa, mutasarr€±f of Hersek to mÌ_sellem of Hersek, €¡brahim KethÌ_da regarding the corsairs from Nova. The PaÙa asked €¡brahim kethÌ_da personally go to the area and destroy those corsair ships. If he cannot go, he is asked to send trustable men to do so.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  69 70
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo regarding extra customs fees demanded from the Venetian merchants bringing in goods in Haleb. Many orders were already sent regarding the same issue but previous defterdar, Mehmed, acted on anorder from Maliye (Finance Dept.) and demanded more fees than it was written in the ahdname from the Venetians. However, it is ordered that they will be charged only what is written and decided in the ahdname. Their goods will be opened only in Haleb. It is also ordered that the decree that was sent from Maliye saying that the Venetians are to be charged more for treasury are to be sent back to the Porte.
agencies: Haleb Eyaletinde vezirim olan Ahmed PaÙa;Haleb Kad€±s€±;Haleb Defterdar€±;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  71 72
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyis, kad€±s and defterdars of Haleb and TrablusÙam upon the bailo's request regarding the extra customs fees demanded from the Venetian merchants. It is said that ahdname is read again. Accordingly the document lists the fees that are to be demanded from the merchant. It is ordered that nothing more than that is to be demanded and such people at the ports are to be warned.
agencies: Haleb Beylerbeyi;Haleb Kad€±s€±;Haleb Defterdar€±;Trablus Beylerbeyi;Trablus Kad€±s€±;Trablus Defterdar€±;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  73 74
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyis, kad€±s and defterdars of Haleb and TrablusÙam upon the bailo's request regarding the extra customs fees demanded from the Venetian merchants. Although decrees sent previously, the officials at the ports continue to charge extra fees. In this document those fees and percentages are given for each tem suhc as clothes, Ì¤uha etc.It is ordered that nothing more than what is written in the ahdname is to be demanded.
agencies: Haleb Beylerbeyi;Haleb Kad€±s€±;Haleb Defterdar€±;Trablus Beylerbeyi;Trablus Kad€±s€±;Trablus Defterdar€±;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  75
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Grand Vizier Nasuh PaÙa to the beylerbeyi of Haleb, Ahmed PaÙa regarding the Venetians in Haleb. Nasuh PaÙa asks Ahmed that the Venetian bailo and merchants should be protected and no extra customs fees should be demanded from them as ordered from the Porte with decrees. Ahmed is asked not to let anyone harass the merchants. He is also reminded that the bailo in Haleb is a relative of the bailo at the Porte. Thus, Ahmed is said that he should not compare the Venetian bailo with any other one Haleb.Apparently the Venetian bailo is more important than any other nation's bailos in Haleb.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  76
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi and kad€± of Haleb upon the bailo's request regarding the Venetians in Haleb. It is said that the current bailo in Haleb is a relative of the bailo in Istanbul. Because of that and of the ahdname, bailo, dragomans and the merchants are to be protected by the current office holders in Haleb. Any case that is outlined in the ahdname related to the bailo are to be transferred to the Porte. If the bailo becomes a guarantor for a Venetian merchant who has a court case, the merchant is not to be imprisoned.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  77
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo in €¡stanbul regarding treatment of the Venetians in Haleb in accordance with the ahdname and ancient laws. They are not to be oppressed or harassed. Moreover, the value of their goods are to be determined and the customs fees are to be demanded according to the what is decided in the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 330 Page  27
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of Tripoli upon the bailo's request regarding remaining debt of the late Mansur bey. After his death, his son, Mehmed, who is sancaq bey and emin of Tripoli, came to Istanbul  admitted his fathers debt and paid 4 thousand gold of the 10-thousand debt. He promised to pay the remaining balance in installements but failed to do so. Kad€± is ordered to collect this money.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  78
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Haleb regarding the Venetian bailo in Haleb. He is reminded that the Venetians are to be protected in accordance with the ahdname. In spite of this, when the bailo visited Ahmed PaÙa to discuss some issues between him and a non-Muslim Ottoman emin (Bedika), this non-Muslim spoke insolently with the bailo according to the report of the bailo in €¡stanbul. Now, Ahmed PaÙa is ordered to have this non-Muslim brought and scold him in the presence of the Venetian bailo. He is also ordered to take away mal-€± miri (anything that belongs to the treasury) from Bedika's possession.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  79
english_summary: See therecord no 277. Fetva given by a mÌ_ftÌ_ or kad€± regarding how to punish the non-Muslim Ottoman subject who insulted the Venetian bailo in Haleb. He will be punished by being beaten up.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  80
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Grand Vizier Nasul PaÙa to the beylerbeyi of Haleb regarding the punishment of the non-Muslim Ottoman subject who insulted the Venetian bailo in Haleb. The beylerbeyi is asked to obey the imperial decree sent before and act accordingly.

english_summary: Order sent to the defterdar of Haleb regarding Bedika who was punished because of his insult to the Venetian bailo in Haleb. Defterdar is also ordered to supervise the transfer and treat the Venetian bailo in accordance with the ahdname. He is also ordered to protect the Venetians.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 332 Page  87
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Grand Vizier Nasuh PaÙa to the beylerbeyi of Haleb regarding his good treatment of the Venetians in the province. He is also asked to continue to obey the rules of the ahdname in his dealing with the bailo and Venetian merchants and never let anyone oppress them.

The text lists the duties and responsibilities of the new consul including his duties for Venetian slaves, Venetian traders, ships, and judicial affairs in the district.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  101
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€±s of Kesendire and Koloz regarding procurement of grains for bailo's men in Girid (Crete). As it was the case last year, this year the bailo's men in Girid will be sent grains to be purchased with their money. The kad€±s are ordered to provide the captain, Sova of Galata, with the grains and let him take it to Girid.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  102

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  103
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r regarding the extra customs fees demanded from the Venetian merchants at the port of €¡skenderiye and in M€±s€±r. The beylerbeyi is ordered to make sure the merchants are treated in accordance with the ahdname and not demanded extra fees.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  104
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r regarding the payment of customs fees by the Venetian merchants. Normally Venetian merchants pay the fees in accordance with the ahdname and as explained on time. However, the emin of M€±s€±r tried to enter their storages and record their belongings in a register so that he could demand customs fees accordingly. However, this is not the way that is explained in the ahdname. So the beylerbeyi is ordered to ensure that the Venetian merchants pay only what is indicated in the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  105
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r upon the request of the bailo regarding some Venetian merchants' fees at the customs. When the merchants arrived, they paid some cash in advance and received a temessÌ_k for that. When they returned again, the emin was replaced by another one who did not accept the temessÌ_k of the previous emin and demanded the customs fees in cash again. Moreover, he harassed the merchants. The beylerbeyi is ordered to protect the merchants and intefere and solve the above mentioned problem.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  106
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Grandvizier Nasuh PaÙa to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r regarding the issue mentioned in the entry no 304. He is asked to solve the issue and ensure that the emins receive the customs fees as it is indicated in the ahdname.
agencies: Veziriazam Nasuh PaÙa;M€±s€±r Beylerbeyi Mehmed PaÙa;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  107
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of Jarusalem upon the request of the bailo regarding priests of the church at the site of the birthplace of Jesus. These priests were given the privilage of carrying the keys of the above mentioned church. However, some Muslims began to harass them for these keys. The kad€± is ordered to protect the priests and their rights to carry the keys. If those Muslims continue to oppress these priests, the kad€± is ordered to report them to the Porte and if they present an order, the kad€± is to send the order to the Porte for inspection.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  108

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  109
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€±s of Gelibolu and Bo€Ùazhisar and dizdars of bo€Ùazhisar upon the request of the bailo regarding the Venetian ships sailing from Istanbul to their own country. However, some emins and others in Gelibolu have been stopping the Venetian ship and keeping them for days by claiming that they carry illegal items. They are also ordered to report those evil-doers to the Porte if they insist on doing such things.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  132

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  41641
english_summary: NiÙan given in regards to some Muslim merchants who purchased some materials from Venice and loaded them on Venetian ships which were attached by Spanish navy and confiscated by them. Now the merchants want to sue the Venetian bailo due to their losses as the bailo is representative of the Venetian beys. However, bailo says that he is only the Venetian envoy not the guarantor of the Venetian beys. NiÙan is given to the Venetians ordering that the bailo cannot be suedby the merchants due to their losses and Venetian ships and subjects are not to be attacked.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  4
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Grand Vizier to the Venetian Doge about some issues that were raised by the Porte including return of a galiot which was demanded to be returned to the Porte. The letter of submission of the doje was received in Istanbul and the doge is asked to continue his loyalty and service.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 334 Page  6

english_summary: HÌ_ccet given to FranÌ¤esko, Anton, and Petro who gave 92 Muslim merchants 70,000 guruÙ. The customs registers will be controlled and if their value is less than 186,000, these 92 merchants will pay 70,000 back to FranÌ¤esko, Anton, and Petro. They promise not to open law suit against anyone for their losses in exchange for this payment.

The ships were attacked by corsairs from North Africa and one of them was captured and taken to the fortress of Moton. In Moton, the corsairs sold the ship to the dizdar of the fortress. The other two ships took refuge in the fortress of Anavarin because they trusted the ahdname between the Porte and Venice. However, the dizdar of Anavarin confiscated the two Venetian ship and their belongings including cash money. Now the sancakbeys of Rodos and Mora are ordered to find and return those three ships and their belongings to the men of the Venetians that will come to the area. They are also ordered to punish the dizdars.

They attacked Venetian lands and caused so much losses and enslaved many people. As it is required by the ahdname, Venetians are to be protected. However, some officials and locals in Nova collaborated with the corsairs and attacked them. Now the beylerbeyi is ordered to punish those people as an example and obey the orders sent from the Porte.

Corsari et altri ladri, et percio la magior parte di quelli che negotiano vano et vengono sani et salvi, et non vien fatto alcun danno alle persone di Viandanti ne alle loro robbe, et havendo per il title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 336 Page  1
english_summary: Mektub sent by the Ottoman sultan to the Dodge of Venice regarding several disputes between the Venetians and the Ottomans. According to ahdname and conditions of peace, ships from the Porte and Venice are supposed to be in peace when they come accross each other on the sea. However, there was a battle between Venetian ships and Ottoman ones in the port of Andize as reported by Perviz Bey. The issue was solved through the Venetian bailo in Istanbul. The Dodge is asked to ensure that the Venetians obey the peace as well. Moreover, the Porte sent orders to the border districts in Bosnia ordering them not to attack the Venetian territories. In the same vein, the dodge is asked to ensure that the Venetians don't attack the Ottoman lands.

On several occasions the dodge complained about the corsairs and the paÙa has been trying to get rid of these corsairs for the sake of friendship. Moreover, according to ahdname and conditions of peace, ships from the Porte and Venice are supposed to be in peace when they come accross each other on the sea. However, there was a battle between Venetian ship led by the Venetian admiral of Crete and Ottoman ships in the port of Andize as reported by Perviz Bey. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  57 58

At this point as loyal allies of the Porte, they need more soldiers and grain. For this reason, the Ottomans administrators are ordered to allow them to purchase grain and register men who are willing to fight for the Venetians. Those men could be Muslims or non-Muslims. english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regarding the situation of Venice . As reported the Spanish king has been threatening Venice and its allies with his armies for the last fewyears. The Venetians are using their army and other resources to deal with this threat. It is also important for the Porte that the Spanish be repelled. At this critical times, the Uskok corsairs have been attacking the Venetians lands and subjects. Since Venice has no resources now, the beylerbeyi is ordered to capture the Uskoks and prevent them from attacking the Venetian lands .

Now the Spanish armada has been reported to enter the bay (Venetian) and could attack the Venetian lands and even the Ottoman possessions. The beylerbeyi is ordered to send letters to the governors in the area and ask them to make their soldiers ready and be in alliance with the Venetian governors in repelling the Spanish.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  109

However, he died on the way and the order was not realized. Now, another order was sent again in this vein. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  116

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  118
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the request of the bailo regarding the customs fees demanded at the port of €¡zmir. In the past, the Venetian merchants came to the port and traded in peace. However, recently the emins decided that they would demand the customs fees in advance. And they in this way oppressed the Venetian merchants who lost too much money in the process. The kad€± is ordered to stop these emins. If they continue, the kad€± is to report them with their names and descriptions to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  120
english_summary: Order sent to the Kapudan PaÙa upon the request of the bailo regarding the North African corsair ships in the Mediterranean. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  121
english_summary: Order sent to the Kapudan PaÙa upon the request of the bailo regarding a certain Ottoman subject, _aban Reis, who had been a Venetian subject from Zakise then converted to Islam. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  122
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of M€±s€±r upon the request of the bailo regarding the customs fees demanded from the Venetian merchants. They tried to force their ways and oppressed the merchants who did not pay in advance. This created many problems as some of the emins left and some even died. In the process, the Venetian merchants lost so much money. The beylerbeyi is ordered to stop such implementations and ensure that the officials obey the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  123
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regarding a certain Receb who was a Venetian subject known as Frank and then converted to Islam. However, it has been reported that he returned back to Bosna again. The beylerbeyi is ordered to capture him and punish him accordingly.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  124
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna and sancakbey of Kilis regarding the attacks of some Ottoman subject on the Venetian lands which is against the conditions of peace and ahdname. Ottoman subjects Ali and Mustafa forcefully took some of the lands that belong to the Venetians. In spite of orders from Kilis they refused to give up and continued to harass and oppress the Venetian subjects in the area. The Ottoman officials are ordered to find them and stop them from attacking the Venetians. If they insist, the Ottoman offcials are to punish them accordingly. The text gives a background info about the border and rights of the Venetians.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  126

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  153
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regarding a certain €¡brahim A€Ùa who lives close to the Venetian border. He has been harassing the Venetian subjects and attacking the Venetian lands for a while. As this is against the ahdname, the beylerbeyi is ordered to summon him and warn him that he should not attack the Venetian subjects anymore. He is to ensure that ahdname is obeyed in his region.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  154
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regarding the border between Venice and Ottoman lands in Bosna. Although niÙans and ahdname were granted to the Venetians securing their lands and subjects, some people did not obey these. Some people from Nova is reported to have built some building in the lands that is close to Korfoz and belongs to the Venetians. The beylerbeyi is ordered to investigate the issue and see if the building is really in the Venetian lands. If so, he is ordered to have it abandoned. He is also ordered to ensure that Venetian lands are not attacked. If those people continue their claims, the beylerbeyi is to report them to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  155
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± of €¡zmir upon the request of the bailo regarding the Venetian consul in €¡zmir. It is reported that two Jewish people owe him 2 thousand guruÙ. They signed a document regarding this but he is not paid. The kad€± is ordered to investigate the case in accordance with the sheri laws. If the case what has been reported is true, the kad€± is ordered to collectthe consul's money from these two Jewish.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  156
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey of €¡lbasan and kad€± of D€±raÌ¤ upon the request of the bailo regarding the Venetian subjects trading in the area. Traditionally Venetians from Parast region trade with the Ottoman ports in the lands of Albania. They buy grains and pay according to the daily rate. They also pay their customs dues and go to their own lands. Recently some Venetians came to the port of Pastova, bought 6 thousand guruÙ worth of grains and paid their customs dues. However, some evil people attacked them and took their belongings including their cash, clothes and grain on the ship. They even tried to kill the Venetians. The sancakbey and kad€± are ordered to find those evil doers and return belongings and cash of Venetians. They are to report those attackers to the Porte and punish them accordingly.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  157
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbeys of €¡lbasan, Ohri and Avlonya and kad€± and emins of D€±raÌ¤ upon the request of the bailo regarding the grain trade between the Venetians and Ottomans in the region. It has been a tradition that the spare grain of the Ottoman districts mentioned above could be sold to the Venetians if the Ottoman subjects want to sell. In this regard, the Ottoman officials are ordered to allow the Venetian buy spare grains from the Ottomans and expell those who try to oppress the Venetians or interfere in their affairs.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  158
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi, kad€± and defterdar of Haleb upon the request of the bailo regarding the emins in Haleb. The emins are supposed to demand 2 akÌ¤e per 100 akÌ¤e for the clothes. The value is determined by the emins as well. Recently these emins calculated the total value of the Venetian goods more than they actually are so that they could demand more fees for the customs. Because of this reason many merchants and emins have judicial cases. The emins are warned but they continue to do so saying that the decision has not been made. This situation created many problems for the merchants. In this regard, the Ottoman officals are ordered to investigate the issue. If what has been reported is true, then they are ordered to expell these emins and stop such implementations. If the emins present them orders from the Porte, the Ottoman officials are to send those to the Porte and wait for the answer.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 251, fasc. 337 Page  159

english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey and mÌ_fettiÙ (investigator ) of Mora regarding the treatment of Venetians coming from Zakise to Mora. In accordance with the ahdname, they are to be protected. However, from time to time some people imprison their envoys or merchants claiming they they have money to receive from the Venetians. These acts are not approved by the Porte and are to be prevented. The Ottoman officials are ordered to treat them well and protect them.

english_summary: NiÙan granted to the Venetian consul in the TrablusÙam area, Marko Sudarenti. This long document describes the rights and responsibilities of the Venetian consul in the area and the rules that the Ottoman officials have to obey. Below are some of them Disputes between the Venetian subjects are to be referred to the bailo.Apart from customs fees that are determined in the ahdname, no more fees, taxes are to be requested from the Venetian merchants trading at the Ottoman ports. In case of a Venetian subject escapes from Venice and takes refuge in the Ottoman lands, he is to be returned if requested by bailo. No one should oppress or demand tribute from dragomans that are in the service of bailos and consuls.Any disputes involving the Venetian consuls should be referred to the Porte and heard in the Imperial Council so that no one will oppress them locally. Consuls and dragomans are not to be oppressed.

english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi and defterdar of Cyprus upon the request of the bailo regarding the customs fees demanded from Venetian merchants. There have been several disputes when merchants purchase goods at Cyprus and pays their customs fees in cash based on the amount of cash not amount of the good. The beylerbeyi and defterdar are ordered to ensure that merchants who buy with cash pay in full and finsh the sale procedures at once.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  38
english_summary: Order sent to the current beylerbeyi of Cyprus in response to the letter of the previous beylerbeyi of Cyprus regarding the new dragoman in Cyprus. The previous dragoman, Loyzo, gave his position with his own will to Piero who is also a resident non-Muslim in Cyprus because Loyzo had been dragoman since the conquest of the island and is now very old. The beylerbeyi is reminded that a dragoman (tercÌ_man) who is close to Cyprus (--- the Ottoman word is "karib" means close****they may mean that he is an Ottoman subject) is good for treasury. He is ordered to protect the dragoman and allow him to work.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  37

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  10
english_summary: Order sent to Ali ÌàavuÙ of the Porte upon the request of the bailo regarding a certain Venetan noble who went to Sak€±z on a Muslim boat for trade but on the road was killed with his servant. The boat people refused that and claimed that the Venetian was enslaved by corsairs. In case he has really been enslaved, Ali ÌàavuÙ is ordered to find him and his servant and free them. He is also ordered to report those who are responsbile for the Venetian noble's enslavement to the Porte.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  9
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Kefe upon the request of the bailo regarding money of two Venetian merchants. The beylerbeyi has the money of these merchants and these merchant sent one of their man to collect it. However, their man died in Kefe. Some Ottoman officials including emins demanded the money saying that it belonged to the dead person. The beylerbeyi is ordered not to allow anyone interfere with this issue and give the money to the current representative of the above mentioned merchants or send it to them with a trusted man.
agencies: Kefe Beylerbeyisi Mehemed;Kefe kad€±s€± ve eminleri

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  8
english_summary: Order sent to the beylerbeyi of Bosna upon the request of the bailo regardingthe sancakbey of K€±rka, €¡brahim. The sancakbey had the same position before and he was known to attack Venetian lands and subjects. The beylerbeyi is ordered to investigate the issue. If it is true that the same €¡brahim bey attacked the Venetian lands before, the beylerbeyi is to warn him so that he will obey the ahdname and not harm the friendship with Venice.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  7
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey, kad€± and officers in Jarusalem upon the request of the bailo regarding the guardian in Jarusalem. The guardian, FranÌ¤esko €¡spalo, visited Haleb and now is returning. The Ottoman officials are warned that this is not a new appointment so he should not pay anything and he should not be oppressed or harassed when he comes back to Jarusalem.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  6
english_summary: Order sent to the Venetian bailo in response to his arz regarding bad treatment of Venetian merchants at the port of Trablus where they usually go. Because of the treatment, however, the bailo requested that merchant go to €¡skenderun and an inn be built in that are for the merchants. His request was accepted and an order was sent to the beylerbeyi of Haleb in regard to building an inn in that area.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  5
english_summary: Order sent to the former beylerbeyi of Haleb upon the request of the bailo regarding the port of €¡skenderun and building of a new inn in that area for Venetian merchants. Venetian merchants who used to go to Trablus complained about the bad treatment by the defterdars and other officials at that port and requested to go to €¡skenderun instead. Their request was accepted and now an inn is needed in the area for their stay and safety.
agencies: Sab€±kan Haleb beylerbeyi olan Elvend(?) o€Ùlu Ali;Venedik balyosu

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 252, fasc. 343 Page  4
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey and kad€± of €¡skenderiye upon the request of bailo regarding one of bailo's man who was imprisoned by the voivoda od PodgoriÌ¤e. The sancakbey and kad€± are ordered to warn the voivoda and other officials in the region and ensure that they obey the ahdname. Those who don't obey are to be reported to the Porte with their names and descriptions.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Documenti piÌ_, b. 368F  Page  1
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± and sancakbey of Jarusalem upon the arz of the clergy of the church of Kamame. They reported that Ottoman officials including emins and subaÙ€±s and ammals and also some other people have been harassing and oppressing them for money. The sancakbey and kad€± are ordered to have a court case and listen to them. They are ordered to decide in accordance with the ancient laws and justice.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Documenti piÌ_, b. 368F  Page  2
english_summary: NiÙan granted to the Catholic priests and clergy in Jarusalem. This niÙan is prepared as a result of the order that is summarized in record no 946. The niÙan detailedly mentions the borders and the areas at Kamame and other churches in Jarusalem that will be under the administration and control of the Catholic priests.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Documenti piÌ_, b. 368F  Page  41702
english_summary: Order sent to the kad€± and sancakbey of Jarusalem. It has been reported that some other people have been harassing and oppressing the priests and visitorfor money. The sancakbey and kad€± are ordered to stop these people and ensure that ancient laws are obeyed.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  15
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey of Kilis upon the request of the Venetian bailo in istanbul regarding some muslim Ottoman subjects illegaly using Venetian lands, territories attached to the fortress of Zadra that had been a part of Venice since the peace treaty during the reign of Sultan Selim. This order was to be delivered by Mustafa ÌàavuÙ from the Porte. The sancakbeyi is ordered to personally go to the borderland and inpect the issue. He is also to prevent actions that are against the ahdname from happening.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  16
english_summary: Orders sent from Vizier Sinan Pasha to the kad€± of Kilis regarding illegal use of Venetian lands on the border attached to the fortress of Zadra. Vizier asks the kad€± to return illegaly used lands to the Venetians and reminds him that the Porte does not approve of such actions that are against the ahdname.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  17
english_summary: Mektub sent from Vizier Mehmed PaÙa regarding the border disputes around Zadra. The Ottoman official(s) are reminded that an imperial order was sent from the Porte and delivered by Mustafa ÌàavuÙ. Thay are asked to carry out the orders and prevent Ottoman subject from actions that are not in accordance with the ahdname. Ottoman subjects oppressing Venetian subjects are to be stopped.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  18
english_summary: Fetva by a kad€± or mÌ_ftÌ_ regarding the border disputes between the Ottoman and Venetian subjects. It mentions that the border was drawn between the dar'Ì_l-islam and the infidel's lands by ahdname and that some Muslims attacked and seized lands that belonged to the Venetians. As imperial order dictates, this is against the ahdname and such actions are not permitted. These lands are to be returned.
transliteration: Selatin-i maziden beri memalik-i €¡slamiyyeyi feth itdÌ_kde Venedik kafiri ile sulh idÌ_b havra-i €¡slamiyyeye dahil olan memalik ile memalik-i kafire ortas€±nda had ta‰Û÷yin idÌ_b ba‰Û÷z-€± alamet ile s€±nur ve men‰Û÷ olunub kat‰Û÷a taraf€±ndan tecavÌ_z olunmya deyÌ_ ahdnameler ve hÌ_ccetler yaz€±lm€±Ù olsa ba‰Û÷dehu darÌ_‰Ûªl-islamda olan ba‰Û÷z-€± kimesneler hadd-€± mezkurdan tecavÌ_z idÌ_b keferenÌ_n zabtlar€±nda olan ba‰Û÷z-€± yerlerin cebren alub zabt ve tasarruf itdÌ_klerÌ_nde kefere sa‰Û÷detlÌ_ padiÙah din-i penah hazretlerine ‰Û÷arz-u hal risale idÌ_b padiÙah-€± alem-penah hazretleri dahi vech-i muharrer Ì_zere hadimvaz‰Û÷i ve ta‰Û÷yin buyurdu€Ùu hadus-€± nurdan kat‰Û÷a tecavÌ_z olunmayub al€±nan yerleri yine virÌ_lÌ_b nakz-€± ahd itmekden hader ideler deyÌ_ emr-i Ùerif virmiÙ olsalar mezburlar emr olunanlara ita‰Û÷at itmek laz€±m olur fi beyan buyurulub mesab oluna. title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  19 20
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey and kad€± of KÌ_ds upon the bailo's request regarding visit of Venetian subjects and repair of a church called Kamame in the city in accordance with the ahdname. The sancakbeyi and kad€±are ordered to protect those people and priests in the church and to allow them to repair necessary areas in the church complex.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  21 22
english_summary: Order sent to the sancakbey of Hersek and kad€± of Nova upon the request of the bailo in €¡stanbul regarding construction of new (three) f€±rkatas in the fortress of Nova, which is against the ahdname. Ottoman subject used these ships in the bay of Venice and attacked Venetian subjects. As this is againt the condition of peace and ahdnane, the Ottoman officials are ordered to stop construction of f€±rkatas and kay€±k and obey the previous orders that had been sent from the Porte about these issues.

title: ASVe, Bailo a Costantinopoli, Carte turche, reg. 250, fasc. 331 Page  22 23
english_summary: NiÙan granted to the Venetians by the Porte. This document outlines rights and obligations of the Venetian merchant , including the bailo, consuls, dragomans, merchants, and others. Accordingly, if a Venetian ship is attacked by Muslim or non-Muslim corsairs in the areas under the Ottoman jurisdiction, the Ottoman authorities are responsible to return goods that are stolen. If those goods are found in possession of an Ottoman subject, they are to be extracted and returned even if they claim to have paid for those. Dizdars of fortresses that are on the shore are to refuse entry of corsair ship and prevent trade with them. If possible they are to capture those corsairs.Disputes between the Venetian subjects are to be referred to the bailo.Apart from customs fees that are determined in the ahdname, no more fees, taxes are to be requested from the Venetian merchants trading at the Ottoman ports. In case of a Venetian subject escapes from Venice and takes refuge in the Ottoman lands, he is to be returned if requested by bailo. Non-Venetian subject travelling on Venetian ships are not to be enslaved. If galleys or other ships of the navy come accross Venetian ships, they must not demand any gifts or money. Ships for commercial purposes from Crete or other islands can carry out commercial activities and no one must demand extra fees, taxes from them. No one should oppress or demand tribute from dragomans that are in the service of bailos and consuls.Uskoks residing in the fortress of Seng and warring on the sea and land are subjects of the BeÌ¤(Habsburg) King and Venetians are not to held respobsible for their attacks. Venetian subjects and their allies are allowed to visit safely Jarusalem and repair the church called Kamame.Any disputes involving the Venetian consuls should be referred to the Porte and heard in the Imperial Council so that no one will oppress them locally. Consuls and dragomans are not to be oppressed.

Nelle medesime di n.o 165 intendemo li prudenti ufficij
transcription: 5r [...] Nelle medesime di n.o 165 intendemo li prudenti ufficij, che havete passato per risposta alle richieste 5v di Saban Francese rinegato, per la sodisfattione del scritto fabricato dal rinegato Lucadello, di preteso credito de 25m c.ni co'l giÌÊ Cav.r Giustiniano v'ro Precessore, vi sete anco per questa occasione in tutto portato conforme alla n'ra intentione, et con quelli prudenti avvertimenti, che richiedeva per se stesso il negocio importantissimo: Ma perche nel suo ragionamento vÌÊ egli spargendo qualche voce di dar il scritto al Defterdar, che vuol dir al fisco, questa sarebbe risolutione gravissima per le consequenze, che porteria seco, doverete per tanto divertirla con quei mezi, che vi pareran'o proprij, senza pero interessarvi il publico in alcuna maniera, ma con via lontana, destra, et prudente, come sete usato, farete che non segua la consegna sopradetta, et resti si puÌ_ quel scritto abbollito, et quando pur egli presista nel volerlo conservare, procurarete di quel modo, che giudicarete poter maggiormente giovare alla v'ra intentione di haverne sincere informationi, levandoli la fede, et le speranze di pagamento, massime quando dovesse capitare nel fisco; accioche cada ogni speranza di essatione, et sia per sempre sollevata la Rep.ca da ogni, et qualonque travaglio, che ogni ragione i persuade ÌÊ non lo dover temere: Et perche pur anche hÌÊ detto volerlo mandar di quÌÊ, lo assicurarete in questo caso, che riconosciuto il scritto per giuridico, et senza fraude, haverÌÊ occasione di conoscere quale si sia la v'ra volontÌÊ, nel farli am'inistrare ragion, et giustitia, per far che sia pagato da chi di ragione si aspetterÌÊ; ma il soppire[?] per sempre questo negocio, saria il meglio di tutte le rissolutioni, si come ce lo promette la molta prudenza, et virtÌ_ v'ra. 7/18/1629 40v Seben noi ancora concorriamo nel vostro parere, che sia difficile cavar dalle mani di Saban Francese il scritto falsamente fabricato dal rinegato Lucadello; tuttavia potendo questo servir ÌÊ qualche tempo ÌÊ dan'o delle cose publiche, per le sugiestioni delli huomini, che mai mancano, di perversa natura, confidiamo assai nella virtÌ_ v'ra che possiate, con cauta maniera procurare la sua abbollitione, la qual potrÌÊ se non giovare in tutte le occorrenze al n'ro servitio.

title: Le vostre prudenti avvertenze alli
english_summary: regarding his leave of absence in Moldavia
transcription: 9v letter to bailo: Le vostre prudenti avvertenze alli andamenti del Grillo, sono parti di quel zelo, che v'accompagna ÌÊ tutte le fontioni al segno di n'ro pieno compiacimento; sopra l'aviso, che ci diede il v'ro Precessore delli novi interessi suoi col Moldavo per occasione di nozze, e di qualche indispositione che sopra venne all Dragom: med.o conosciuto dÌÊ Noi il frutto che si receverebbe dal vedere instrutto sotto la sua disciplina alcun altro, scrivessimo ad esso 10r Bailo, che andasse con soavitÌÊ maneggiando il negocio, coll' oggetto del Sollevo et piena sod.ne del Dragom.e, come vederete dall' ingionta copia[.] Le risposte furono, che haverebbe di ciÌ_ tenuto discorso seco; che ben conosceva il vantaggio di quest' introduttione, mÌÊ che vi scopriva difficoltÌÊ non solo per la parte del Grillo, mÌÊ di quello, che dovesse esser sostituito ÌÊ tal ministerio; che perÌ_ sarebbe andato domesticando l'affarre, perche dalla virtÌ_ vostra fosse poi formalmente pratticato; Noi attennendosi ÌÊ puri termini delle accennate deliberationi, dovemo confirmarvi il med.o col Senato, havendo perÌ_ con la solitÌÊ [sic] desteritÌÊ v'ra oggetto p'npale di far conoscere al Dragomano il vostro desiderio della sua presservatione, il contento publico per il suo fruttuoso impiego, mÌÊ considerandole d'altro canto, che d'avenzamento suo ne gli anni, la poca robustezza nella natora, et li accidenti, ÌÊ quali Ì¬ sottoposto ogn' huomo faran trovar buono questo mezzo, per sollevarlo in qualche parte mandando con lui hor l'uno, hor l'altro de n'ri Dragom.i perche habbino modo d'apprendere dalla sua isperienza qualche maggior habilitÌÊ di servire di quello che egli vi risponderÌÊ, et de sui veri sensi, attenderemo v'ri avisi; et se vedeste quella renitenza in lui, che vi disse l'Allessandri non darete perciÌ_ alcun segno di disgusto. 5/11/1643 14r Al Dragom: Grillo, esprimerete l'avvertenze del Senato per quelle preavertenze prudenti, con che mira al nostro servicio, et al suo sollevo, con dispositione di condurre presso di lui altro soggetto, che coadiuvi le sue fattiche. al qual passo doverete esprimervi che questa diligenza mira al solo fine de haver li Dragomani nostri ben instrutti, et informati della sua esperienza, non per dar vantaggi di prelatione piÌ_ ad uno, che all'altro; per questo hor l'uno, hor l'altro, sarÌÊ bene, che egli habbia appresso di se, senza distintione di persone, mÌÊ con oggetto di avanzare habilitÌÊ. 7/16/1643 24r-v Se il Dragom.n Grillo dissente dall' haver Compagno nella sua carrica noi all' incontro, riconoscendo altrettanto profficua l'introduttione, siamo certi che non perdendo la Fraccia[?], et tenendo viva la prattica con quella desteritÌÊ, che Ì¬ vostra propria lo disperete ÌÊ riconoscere per sollevo quello che ei crede fose titolo di obligatione, et di aggravio. 9/18/1643 32r Il senso, che havete osservato nel Dragoman Grillo per questo negocio stabilito senza sua notitia, e consiglio, deve maggiormente far conoscere la necessitÌÊ di valersi di tutti li Dragomani in varij negocij; acciÌ_ tutti s'applichino, s'informino, et habbino prattica di trattare con Ministri, et un solo non faccia tutte le cose con tutti, per assueffar[?] molti; per questa causa vi valerete hora di uno, hor dell' altro per assuefar molti; secondo la qualitÌÊ de negocij, et l'attitudine, insinuendo sempre al Grillo ÌÊ condur seco alle volte, alcuno delli Dragomani per instruirli, et incaminarli sotto la sua disciplina e virtÌ_, caminerete seco con l'amorevolezza vostra solitÌÊ, per non sgustarlo, mÌÊ procederete con tutto il riguardo di circonspettione, e desteritÌÊ.

title: new bailo Marino Cavalli

title: Ser.mo Principe Doppo lungo travaglio
english_summary: letter by baili Capello & Vicenzo Gradenigo: "Mr Steffano Dragomano si trova tuttavia nel letto con la sua miserabile indispositione di una uscera nelle resti [reni?]"
transcription: 264r Ser.mo Principe Doppo lungo travaglio, ch'ha havuto mr Stefano de'i Gioveni Dragomano Grande della sua antica indispositione, ÌÊ 3 del mese presente [1/3/1599] terminÌ_ finalm.e la sua vita. Nel suo testam.to ha instituita herede la Ser.tÌÊ V'ra d'una sua casa situata qui nelle Vigne doppo la morte di una sua Sorella i etÌÊ di sessanta anni in circa co'lle conditioni, che lei vederÌÊ dalla copia del med.mo testamento; il quale volendo V'ra Ser.tÌÊ, che sia sostentato, non sarÌÊ senza qualche difficoltÌÊ co'lla contradittioni de suoi, che asseriscono esser carazari del Gran S.re, et ch'hanno impedito la volontÌÊ del testatore, non havendo voluto le donne, che si facci inventario; ÌÊ che non ci Ì¬ parso di far alcuna violentia, poiche habbiamo ricuperato tutte le scritture pubbliche, che si trovavano appresso di lui: tuttavia per esser stato egli Dragomano ÌÊ suoi stipendij, et per li vantaggi da noi presi, crediamo di poter superar questa difficoltÌÊ: ma conosciamo, che questa non Ì¬ cosa da fargli fondam.to, essendosi oltra li debiti contenuti in esso suo testam.to scoperti molt' altri di consideratione. In questa casa Ì¬ fama, ch'egli habbi speso cinque in se cechini, la qual' in parte Ì¬ habitabile, ma perÌ_ Ì¬ in stato tale, 264v che ÌÊ finirla ci vorriano doi, e piÌ_ mille cechini. Nel rimanente non s'habbiamo lasciato intendere aluna cosa di accettar, Ì_ rifiutar tal' hereditÌÊ, dovendo aspettar noi in occ.ne tale q'nto p.ma espresso ord.e suo per essquirlo essattam.e con ogni prontezza. La morte di questo havendoci astretti di servirsi d'uno de' gl' altri in suo luoco ci mette in necessitÌÊ di dar conto alla Ser.tÌÊ V'ra di tutti questi suoi Dragomani, perche nel fermarne uno coll' Ecc.mo Senato possa ÌÊ questo devenire con buon fondam.to p[er] servitio delle cose sue. Gianesino Selvago fig.lo del GiÌÊ Matecca Perotto Dragomano da strada, per questo riesce, ma non di trattar negotij di momento con grandi. Giuliano Selvago suo fr'ello similm.e per questo di stradda, et altri simili servitij sarÌÊ atto. Thomaso Navon fig.lo del q. Pasqua Perotto Dragomano piÌ_ giovine ancora di quest' altri essendo giÌÊ eletto protogero della Natione attende ben anch'esso al suo carrico, ma non val ne anco lui per le trattationi con grandi. Ambrosio Grillo Perotto , la supp.ne del quale sarÌÊ qui allegata, non havendo noi voluto metter impedim.to ÌÊ chi ricorre immediatam.e ÌÊ lei, Ì¬ inclinato assai alli negotij di Fiorenza, et altre volte essendo qui Dragomano di lei fÌ_ licentiato dal servitio dalla fe: me: dell' Ill.mo S.r 265r Lorenzo Bernardo sogetto di quella integritÌÊ, che Ì¬ molto ben nota, di che et della sua conditione p[er]suadendosi noi, che lei sia informata ÌÊ bastanza; oltra che Ì¬ travagliato quasi ordinariam.e dalle podagre , non ne diciamo altro. Tutti li soprad.ti parlano la lengua turca la magg.r parte di essi ancÌ_ la Greca, et buona parte di loro la schiava. Di questi non ci Ì¬ alc.o, che legga, ne scriva, la turca, che tanto importa . Mr Hier.mo Alberti suo di Canc.ria estraordinario parla, Legge, et scrive beniss.o la lingua turca, et atto ad ogni negotio, havendo faticato assai ÌÊ questa porta, et valendo molto nella via della segretaria, alla quale si vede esser egli inclinato piÌ_ che altrimenti, il quale convenendo anco p[er] interesse delle cose della sua casa, ritornar ÌÊ Vinetia con me Capello conforme alla licentia giÌÊ da lui ottenuta dall'Ecc.mo senato, ivi ancÌ_ ne potrÌÊ la Ser.tÌÊ V'ra da questo suo benemerito ricever ottimo, et fruttuoso servitio. Il Borissi parla, et scrive in molte lingue, come nella Italiana, nelle Valacca, Albanese, Greca, Schiava, Persiana, studia ordinariam.e l'Araba, che quasi possede, et scrivi, et parla la turca cosi elegantem.e, che viene con gran gusto ascoltato dal BassÌÊ, et da tutti li grandi della Porta, da quali Ì¬ cosi ben veduto, che con gran vantaggio egli 265v tratta li negotij della Ser.tÌÊ V'ra : Di man.za, che ritrovandosi essa questo degno ministro, ÌÊ cui non solo di quelli di questa casa, ma altro chi si sia di quelli, che servono alli Rapp'ntanti di altri Prencipi ÌÊ d.ta Porta non Ì¬ alcuno, che possa porgli il piedi innanzi d'intelligentia della lingua turca: oltre alla sinceritÌÊ della fede, alla bontÌÊ, et al merito delle sue fatiche; principalm.e nell'occ.ni della Morea contra leventi, dove senza riguardo della sua vita ha conservato la dignitÌÊ pub.ca, et fatto ben il servitio della Ser.tÌÊ V'ra, si come lei Ì¬ beniss.e informata. Per questo non trovandosi qui in Pera chi possa compararsi alla qualitÌÊ sua, convenimo per grand.mo serv.o di lei river.te dirle, che no' vediamo, chi meglio di lui possa servirla in questo carrico di Dragoman grande, havendo egli per il passato in esso frequentem.e beniss.o servito, et tuttavia se ne vagliano di lui nelli p'nti gravissimi negotij con grand.o frutto in serv.o, et honore della Ser.tÌÊ V'ra, et n'ra sodisfattione: rimettendosi noi perÌ_ in tutto al su sapientissimo giudicio. Dalle cose dette, V'ra Ser.tÌÊ conosce la necessitÌÊ in che siamo di Dragomani atti ÌÊ prestarle fruttuoso serv.o, perÌ_ restando noi in questo solo Borissi, non potendo egli supplir ÌÊ tutte le occorenze, non saperessimo di questi, che habbiamo in casa di chi valersi: PerÌ_ havendo io Gradenigo trovato qui in casa introdotto p[er] ca' di questo bisogno mr Simon de' Piero, nato et allevato in sofia, ma p[er] habitatione di qualche anno in Ragusi, et p[er] esser ancÌ_ stato Dragomano di Ragusi d.o Raguseo huomo da bene, et di molto valore in questo essercitio, et che tratta con ogni vantaggio con grandi, et atto ÌÊ ben intendere le nuove occorrenti , si come della sua persona ne ha essa havuto relatione, p.ma che io qui venissi, ho stimato gran servitio di lei il continuar di trattenirlo qui in casa, con tutto ch'egli fosse rissoluto di partire co'll Ill.mo Capello cosi consigliato ancÌ_ da S. S. Ill.ma, che me ne ha fatto di lui ottima relatione, et condurlo ÌÊ beneplacito di lei di quella man.ra, che la p.ma fiata fÌ_ fatto dall'Ill.mo Card.l Morosini del Dragomano Grillo, se ben con minor provisione di quella io ho havuto fatica ÌÊ fermarlo, essendo stati quelli 250 cechini l'anno, et questi solam.e ducento con promessa, che servendo fedelm.e sarÌÊ da lei di tempo in tempo riconosciuto. Non havendo noi altri, che il Borissi, et questo, il quale ha l'intratura con grandi co'l mezzo d'alcune sue man.re con stupore de tutti, che riesce mirabilm.e, che q'ndo accadono negotij ardui, et importanti parlino alla libera, rapp'ntando 266v li n'ri med.mi concetti senza alc.a sorte di rispetto alli BassÌÊ, et altri Grandi della Porta: Cosa che non ci succede colli Dragomani Perotti, che essendo nativi del paese trattano con certo loro naturale timoroso riguardo, assai pregiudiciale alli negotij, et publica riputatione , come diverse volte io Capello ho provato, et datone conto alla Ser.tÌÊ V'ra. StarÌ_ dunque aspettando io Gradenigo la dichiaratione della sua mente intorno all'uno, et all'altro affine che con tanto maggior animo possino attendere al servitio publico: Affermandole noi unitam.e, che questa materia de' Dragomani Ì¬ delle importanti, che qui possano considerarsi, et uno de mag.r pesi, ch' habbia questo Bailaggio. Gr'e Dalle Vigne di Pera ÌÊ X di Genn.o 1599 Gir.mo Capello Vicenzo Grad.o Cav. Baili
